creator: sasha.matison@ca.com
text:
Hello,

According to the following security advisory http://www.openssl.org/news/secadv_20071012.txt a flaw has been discovered in OpenSSL's DTLS implementation. How does this advisory apply to Apache Server 2.2.6?

More specifically:

- Can DTLS be used in the context of Apache Server? If yes - what needs to be done to enable it?
- Is SSL_get_shared_ciphers() method being used directly/indirectly by the Apache Server code?

Thank you,
Sasha.

First of all bugzilla is no user support forum but for reporting bugs. So please post your question on the users / dev list.
Regarding the security issue: Upgrade your openssl to an unaffected version and you are safe.
